newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-CC-Amatil falls on broker's report.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-CC-Amatil falls on broker's report.

text.p: Shares in regional and Eastern European bottler Coca-Cola Amatil Ltd fell sharply on Wednesday after a newspaper reported that a leading broker had assigned a fair value of about A$5.00 below its current price, dealers said.
The Australian Financial Review newspaper said the First Pacific brokerage firm had allocated a fair value of A$12.50 on C-C Amatil compared with the stock's Monday closing price of A$17.60.
C-C Amatil shares were 15 cents lower at A$17.45 at 10.15 a.m. (0015 GMT).
One broker said the share price fall was also in line with the weakness in the overall market.
"Coke is the kind of stock which tends to move more quickly than others on the upside and the downside," he said.
C-C Amatil, which is 40 percent-owned by The Coca-Cola Co, is one of the most keenly sought stocks on the Australian share market.
The company recently secured further regional bottling rights in Eastern Europe and has also struck an agreement with Malaysian businessman Robert Kuok to take a 9.3 percent stake.
